file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 78-33-06-04 - SEQUENCE VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL SEQUENCE VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the sequence valve. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH thrust reverser. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 78-33-06-000-801-A SEQUENCE VALVE - REMOVAL ALL 78-33-06-400-801-A SEQUENCE VALVE - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 78-33-06 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 78-33-06-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. SEQUENCE VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to remove the sequence valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES ISOLATION CONTROL UNIT - INHIBITION PROCE- AMM TASK 78-33-01-980-801-A/200 DURES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 225DTC Cockpit 416 416AB LH Thrust Reverser 426 426AB RH Thrust Reverser D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the thrust reverser available Commercially Container To catch oil available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Rubber gloves, phosphate ester-base, Protection for the hands 1 available fluid-resistant Commercially Rubber goggles, phosphate ester-base, Protection for the eyes 1 available fluid-resistant F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the work area EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 78-33-06 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A WARNING: • REFER TO THE GROUND SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 WHEN YOU DO THE THRUST REVERSER MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. • MAKE SURE THAT THE THRUST REVERSERS ARE DEENERGIZED. ENERGIZED CIRCUITS CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS. • MAKE SURE THAT THE HYDRAULIC TEST STAND IS NOT CONNECTED. • THE PHOSPHATE-ESTER-BASE OIL IS HIGHLY CORROSIVE AND CAUSES INJURY TO THE EYES AND SKIN. BE CAREFUL NOT TO TOUCH THIS OIL. YOU MUST USE GLOVES AND GOGGLES. CAUTION: • ALWAYS CLEAN THE HYDRAULIC FLUID THAT FALLS FROM THE THRUST REVERSERS. DAMAGE COULD COME FROM ITS CORROSIVE ACTION. • USE APPLICABLE CONTAINERS TO COLLECT THE REMAINING FLUIDS FROM THE OPEN LINES, TO KEEP THE WORK AREA CLEAN AND SAFE. (1) Put the workstand under the engine thrust reverser. (2) On the circuit breaker panel, open the circuit breakers below and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to them: • THRUST REVERSER 1/2. • HYD. ELEC. PUMP 1/2. (3) Put a DO-NOT-OPERATE-THE-THRUST-REVERSERS sign on the instrument panel, in the cockpit. (4) Manually operate the ICU to prevent the operation of the thrust reverser (AMM TASK 78-33-01-980-801-A/200). WARNING: DO NOT APPLY HYDRAULIC POWER TO THE AIRCRAFT, AND DO NOT OPERATE THE THRUST REVERSER WHILE THE MAINTENANCE PERSONS ARE AT WORK. (5) Remove access panels 416AB or 426AB ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100) as applicable, to get access to the sequence valve. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A CAUTION: BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN YOU DISCONNECT HYDRAULIC LINES. SKYDROL FLUID IS HIGHLY DANGEROUS. (1) Loosen the nuts (1), disconnect the hydraulic lines, and install applicable caps in the tubes and in the sequence valve ports. (2) Remove the bolts (2), and washers (3). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 78-33-06 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the sequence valve (4) from the torsion box attaching support (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 78-33-06 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 78-33-06-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. SEQUENCE VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) Obey the instructions below to install the sequence valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-43-00/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 78-31-01-700-801-A/500 THRUST REVERSER - OPERATIONAL CHECK ISOLATION CONTROL UNIT - INHIBITION PROCE- AMM TASK 78-33-01-980-801-A/200 DURES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 225 225DTC Cockpit 416 416AB LH Thrust Reverser 426 426AB RH Thrust Reverser D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Workstand To get access to the thrust reverser available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Thrust reverser EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 78-33-06 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A WARNING: • REFER TO THE GROUND SAFETY PRECAUTIONS GIVEN IN AMM MPP 78-30-00/200 WHEN YOU DO THE THRUST REVERSER MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. • MAKE SURE THAT THE THRUST REVERSERS ARE DEENERGIZED. ENERGIZED CIRCUITS CAN CAUSE INJURY TO PERSONS. • MAKE SURE THAT THE HYDRAULIC TEST STAND IS NOT CONNECTED. (1) Install the sequence valve (4) on the torsion box attaching support (5) with the bolts (2) and washers (3). (2) Remove the caps from the sequence valve (4) ports and hydraulic lines and connect their nuts (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the circuit breakers below and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from them: • THRUST REVERSER 1/2. • HYD. ELEC. PUMP 1/2. (2) Remove the DO-NOT-OPERATE-THE-THRUST-REVERSERS sign from the instrument panel, in the cockpit. (3) Manually operate the ICU to put the thrust reverser back to the serviceable condition (AMM TASK 78-33-01-980-801-A/200). (4) Do the engine thrust-reverser operational check ( AMM TASK 78-31-01-700-801-A/500 - two cycles minimum), and check the system for leaks. (5) Install access panels 416AB or 426AB ( AMM MPP 06-43-00/100), as applicable. (6) Remove the workstand from the work area. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 78-33-06 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
